definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
forced labor/corvée/obligatory task/military service/to use as servant/to enserf/servant (old)/war/campaign/battle

sentences.english: Military sevice will make a man out of you .
sentences.chinese: 服兵役會把你鍛鍊也一個男子漢。

sentences.english: In the period of doing military service, my pressure resistance went on the most progress so far.
sentences.chinese: 在服兵役期間，是目前我的抗壓性成長最明顯的時刻。

sentences.english: Korea still keeps people locked up for refusing to perform military service.
sentences.chinese: 甚至南朝鮮把拒絕服兵役的人關起來。

sentences.english: Is there a civic duty to serve one's country?
sentences.chinese: 公民是否該有爲自己國家服兵役的義務？

sentences.english: He said that's one thing he never want to do again, and same goes as being a soldier.
sentences.chinese: 他說笨豬跳和服兵役是他不願意再做一次的事情。

sentences.english: Even many young students were conscripted into the army.
sentences.chinese: 甚至很多年輕的學生也被徵召到陸軍中服兵役。

sentences.english: The whole male population liable to bear arms was divided on a property basis into six classes.
sentences.chinese: 凡是應服兵役的男子，都按其財產分爲六個階級。

sentences.english: Jack had been excused from military service on account of short-sightedness.
sentences.chinese: 傑克因近視而免服兵役。

sentences.english: It's hard to keep in contact with Kim Jong Kook because he's in Military Service and he's always busy.
sentences.chinese: 金鐘國很難聯絡到因爲他在服兵役而且很忙碌。

definition: to serve in the army/to be a soldier
to be discharged from military service
to return to school (after an interruption)/to resume one's studies
to rise through the ranks (as a party cadre)
to change one's profession/to transfer to civilian work
to become naturalized/to become a citizen
